text: If you have a placeholder, that means you haven't optimised your app for loading whatever
<http://www.androiduipatterns.com/2015/08/splash-screen-with-any-other-name-is.html>
Yup, we don't have loading screens for apps on desktop, do we? Besides these web apps of course (looking at you Slack).
The most annoying thing is that  in YouTube after splash screen disappears you still see progress bar,  so the content is still loading. What it was loading behind the splash screen then? :grin:
I know a lot of desktop tools with loading screens, like… uhm… Android Studio?
Adobe Creative Suite?
Alright, those are exclusive because they need that for indexing and caching
But I don't see why a small app would  need a splash screen like YouTube

hahaha. <@U061HDV96>, Ian and I were just talking about that in another Slack
yeah, if your app is a game then a splash screen is acceptable
if you app is not a game, then you don’t need a splash screen
its pretty simple

<http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/blogspot/hsDu/~3/6GfVTyuJfQs/hungry-for-some-big-android-bbq.html|Hungry for some Big Android BBQ?>
Posted by <https://plus.google.com/+ColtMcAnlis/posts|Colt McAnlis>, Head Performance Wrangler

<http://bigandroidbbq.com|The Big Android BBQ> (BABBQ) is almost here and Google Developers will be there serving up a healthy portion of best practices for Android development and performance! BABBQ will be held at the Hurst Convention Center in Dallas/Ft.Worth, Texas on October 22-23, 2015. 

We also have some great news! If you sign up for the event through August 25th,...

attachments.title: Colt McAnlis - Google+
attachments.text: Colt McAnlis - "If at first, the idea is not absurd, then there is no hope for it" - Developer Advocate - Google - Colt McAnlis is a Developer Advocate at Google focusing on Games and Performance; Before that, he was a graphics programmer in the games industry working at Blizzard, Microsoft (Ensemble), Petroglyph,
So much more than a Developer Conference, The Big Android BBQ is a grassroots, community-driven celebration of Android that is equal parts education, entertainment, and altruism.

<http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/blogspot/hsDu/~3/QA1d9Oscewk/announcing-android-auto-desktop-head.html|Announcing the Android Auto Desktop Head Unit>
Posted by <http://google.com/+jbgordon|Josh Gordon>, Developer Advocate

Today we’re releasing the <https://developer.android.com/training/auto/start/index.html?utm_campaign=DHU-827&utm_source=dac&utm_medium=blog#test-it-dhu|Desktop Head Unit> (DHU), a new testing tool for Android Auto developers. The DHU enables your workstation to act as an Android Auto head unit that emulates the in-car experience for testing purposes. Once you’ve installed the DHU, you can test...

Android Auto extends the Android platform into the car. When users connect their handheld devices running Android 5.0 or higher to a compatible vehicle, the Auto user interface provides a car-optimized Android experience on the vehicle's screen. Users…
